sen.cmt: 「衆徒を防いだ」の部分ですが、永久の強訴は、奈良で起きたもので、僧侶が京に流れ込むのを防いだという意味に解釈しました。

sen.cmt: ローマ字表記(英訳)の順にするため、the Eikyu no Goso (Eikyu Petition)とし、Kofuku-ji Temple, the Retired Emperor Shirakawaとしました。

sen.j: 康治2年（1143年）には大殿こと藤原忠実に溺愛されていた藤原頼長に接近、主従関係を結び、久安6年（1150年）、藤原頼長のために頼賢と兵を率いて関白藤原忠通の別邸を襲って氏長者の印たる朱器台盤を奪う。

tit.cmt: 統一リストの表記に修正

sen.j: 平氏が白河院、鳥羽天皇に重用されるのに対して、為義は源頼義、義家と父祖代々任じられた陸奥国守任官の要望も却下され、30余年もの間、左衛門尉のまま冷遇された。
sen.e: In contrast to the Taira clan, who had been designated high-ranking posts by the retired Emperor Shirakawa and Emperor Toba, Tameyoshi was given the cold shoulder; having had his request to serve as Mutsu-no-kuninokami (chief of the Mutsu-no-kuni province), a post served by his father, MINAMOTO no Yoriyoshi, and his grandfather, MINAMOTO no Yoriie, turned down, he had to serve as Saemon-no-jo for more than thirty years.

In contrast to the Taira clan, who had been given high-ranking posts by the retired Emperor Shirakawa and Emperor Toba, Tameyoshi was given the cold shoulder; having had his request to serve as Mutsu-no-kuninokami (Lord of Mutsu Province), a post served by his father, MINAMOTO no Yoriyoshi, and his grandfather, MINAMOTO no Yoriie, turned down, he had to serve as Saemon-no-jo for more than thirty years.
sen.cmt: "designated"→"given""chief of the Mutsu-no-kuni province"→"Lord of Mutsu Province"
sen.e: In contrast to the Taira clan, who had been given high-ranking posts by the Retired Emperor Shirakawa and Emperor Toba, Tameyoshi was given the cold shoulder; having had his request to serve as Governor of Mutsu Province, a post served by his father, MINAMOTO no Yoriyoshi, and his grandfather, MINAMOTO no Yoriie, turned down, he had to serve as Saemon no jo for more than thirty years.
sen.cmt: the Retired Emperor Shirakawa, Saemon no joとし、陸奥国守→Governor of Mutsu Provinceとしました。

sen.j: それは院政誕生後も相次ぐ家督争いでその風下に立つ事となってしまった摂関家との密接な関係を続けていたのも原因の一つであるが、その事に気づく事無く、ライバルの平氏が摂政藤原忠通と親しかった事に対抗して、父の忠実に溺愛され、有望と見た弟の藤原頼長に接近し、藤氏長者獲得等に貢献した。
sen.e: This is partly because he maintained a close relationship with the losing side of the Sekkan family, who had been plagued with inheritance battles even after the cloister government had been established, and he himself were unaware of it; to compete with the Taira clan who had been close to Tadamichi Fujiwara, the-then Sessho (regent), he approached Yorinaga FUJIWRA, who had been dearly loved by his father, Tadazane, and looked promising, and helped him become the head of the Fujiwara clan.

This is partly because he maintained a close relationship with the losing side of the Sekkan family, who had been plagued with inheritance battles, which Tameyoshi remained unaware of, even after the the system of cloistered rule had been established and to compete with the Taira Clan, who were close to Tadamichi Fujiwara, the Sessho (regent), he approached Yorinaga FUJIWARA, who had been dearly loved by his father, Tadazane, and who looked to have a promising future, helping him become the head of the Fujiwara Clan.
sen.cmt: "cloister government had been established"→"the system of cloistered rule had been established""he himself were unaware of it;"→", which Tameyoshi remained unaware of," and movedsemicolon→"and"Capitalized 'c'"had been"→"were"Deleted "-the"Spelling of "FUJIWARA"Added "who", "to have a", "future""and helped"→"helping"Capitalized 'c'
sen.e: This is partly because he maintained a close relationship with the losing side of the Sekkan-ke, who had been plagued with inheritance battles, which Tameyoshi remained unaware of, even after the the system of cloistered rule had been established and to compete with the Taira clan, who were close to FUJIWARA no Tadamichi, the Sessho (regent), he approached FUJIWARA no Yorinaga, who had been dearly loved by his father, Tadazane, and who looked to have a promising future, helping him become the head of the Fujiwara clan.
sen.cmt: 前出の表記に合わせ、the Sekkan family→the Sekkan-keとし、またthe Taira clan, the Fujiwara clan, FUJIWARA no Tadamichi, FUJIWARA no Yorinagaとしました。

sen.j: 経済的には河内国石川郡壷井（大阪府羽曳野市壷井）の河内源氏本拠地伝来の財産があり裕福であった。
sen.e: Economically, the family was affluent as it had fortunes handed down from generation to generation in their homeland, Tsuboi, Ishikawa-gun, Kawachi province (Tsuboi, Habikino City, Osaka Prefecture).
Financially, the family was affluent as it had fortunes handed down from generation to generation in their homeland, Tsuboi, Ishikawa-gun, Kawachi province (Tsuboi, Habikino City, Osaka Prefecture).
sen.cmt: "Economically"→"Financially"
sen.e: Financially, the family was affluent as it had fortunes handed down from generation to generation in their homeland, Tsuboi, Ishikawa-gun, Kawachi Province (Tsuboi, Habikino City, Osaka Prefecture).
sen.cmt: Kawachi Provinceとしました。

sen.j: また、一族の将来を慮り多くの子供をつくり、養子や猶子も多く、彼らを全国に配置して衰退していた源氏を盛り返そうと為義なりに考えていたことはわかっている。
sen.e: It is known that Tameyoshi was developing his own idea of turning Genji into more prosperous and thriving, which had been declining due to too many offspring produced and scattered across the country through Yoshi (the adoption of relatives) and Yushi (the adoption of non-relatives) because of concerns about their future.

However, it is known that Tameyoshi was developing his own ideas for reviving the fortunes of the Genji, which, because of concerns about their future, had been declining due to too many offspring produced and adopted and scattered across the country.
sen.cmt: Added "However,"Made "idea" plural"of turning Genji into more prosperous and thriving"→"for reviving the fortunes of the Genji"Moved "because of concerns about their future"
sen.e: However, it is known that Tameyoshi was developing his own ideas for reviving the fortunes of the Minamoto clan, which, because of concerns about their future, had been declining due to too many offspring produced and adopted and scattered across the country.
sen.cmt: the Genji→the Minamoto clanとしました。

sen.j: しかし、為義らと運命共同体を成す事となった頼長は確かに学識高く、比類する者（いたとしたら、藤原信西ぐらいであったろう）なきほどであったが、酷薄で融通をつける事を知らず、園社神人と騒動を起こした平氏に厳重な処罰を主張する等周囲から反発を買い、時の近衛天皇にも嫌われていた。
sen.e: However, Yoshinaga, who, in retrospect, was destined to share his fate with Tameyoshi, was certainly a well-learned, knowledgeable man that no one could have competed with (If there had been one, that would have been FUJIWARA no Shinzei), but he was cold, unloving, inflexible; he met with opposition from people around him when he insisted on bringing the Taira clan who had caused trouble with Gionsha Jinin to severe punishment, and he was also hated by the-then Emperor Konoe.

However, Yorinaga, who, in retrospect, was destined to share his fate with Tameyoshi, was certainly a well-learned, knowledgeable man that no one could have competed with (if there was one, it was FUJIWARA no Shinzei), but he was cold, unloving, inflexible and therefore he met with opposition from people around him, when he insisted on punishing the Taira Clan for causing a rebellion by priests from Gionsha Srine, and he was also hated by Emperor Konoe.
sen.cmt: "Yoshinaga"→"Yorinaga""had been"→"was""would have been"→"was"semicolon→"and therefore""bringing the Taira clan who had caused trouble with Gionsha Jinin to severe punishment"→"on punishing the Taira Clan for causing a rebellion by priests from Gionsha Srine"Deleted "the-then"
sen.e: However, Yorinaga, who, in retrospect, was destined to share his fate with Tameyoshi, was certainly a well-learned, knowledgeable man that no one could have competed with (if there was one, it was FUJIWARA no Shinzei), but he was cold, unloving, inflexible and therefore he met with opposition from people around him, when he insisted on punishing the Taira clan for causing a rebellion by priests from Gionsha Shrine, and he was also hated by Emperor Konoe.
sen.cmt: Taira clanとし、Srine→Shrineに修正

sen.j: 折角得た内覧職も後白河天皇即位と共に停止され、失脚の憂き目を見る。
sen.e: Tameyoshi had another downfall; as Emperor Goshirakawa took office, he was dismissed from the hard-won post of Nairan-shoku (document inspector who inspects documents presented to the Emperor in advance).

Tameyoshi had another setback after Emperor Goshirakawa took office, when he was dismissed from the hard-won post of Nairan-shoku (high-ranking official who inspected documents to be presented to the Emperor).
sen.cmt: "downfall; as "→"setback after"moved "when""document inspector"→"high-ranking official"Made "inspects" past tenseAdded "to be"Deleted "in advance
sen.e: Tameyoshi had another setback after Emperor Goshirakawa took office, when he was dismissed from the hard-won post of Nairan-shoku (high-ranking official who inspected documents to be presented to the Emperor).
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 一族についても、次男の源義賢と孫の源義平の対立等内輪揉めが絶えず、前述の久安6年（1154年）年の解官・隠居で既に下野守などに任官した長男、源義朝が家督を次ぐとますます多くの源氏与党の人心は彼から離れ、才幹豊かな義朝に靡いてしまう。
sen.e: The clan was incessantly haunted with internal feuds like the one between his second son, MINAMOTO no Yoshikata, and his grandchildren, MINAMOTO no Yoshihira, and once he was removed from office and forced to retire in 1154 (as stated earlier) and his first son, MINAMOTO no Yoshitomo, who had been appointed Shimotsuke-no-kami (chief of Shimotsuke-no-kuni), took over as the head of the family, other Genji leaders increasingly lost trust and admiration for him, becoming attracted to Yoritomo, who was more capable and competent as a leader.

The clan was incessantly beset by internal feuds like the one between his second son, MINAMOTO no Yoshikata, and his grandchild, MINAMOTO no Yoshihira, and once he was removed from office and forced to retire in 1154 (as stated earlier) and his first son, MINAMOTO no Yoshitomo, who had been appointed Shimotsuke-no-kami (Lord of Shimotsuke Province), took over as the head of the family, other Genji leaders increasingly switched their support to the more capable and competent Yoshitomo.
sen.cmt: "haunted with"→"beset by"Made "grandchildren" singular"chief of Shimotsuke-no-kuni"→"Lord of Shimotsuke Province""lost trust and admiration for him, becoming attracted to Yoritomo, who was more capable and competent as a leader"→"switched their support to the more capable and competent Yoshitomo"
sen.e: The clan was incessantly beset by internal feuds like the one between his second son, MINAMOTO no Yoshikata, and his grandchild, MINAMOTO no Yoshihira, and once he was removed from office and forced to retire in 1154 (as stated earlier) and his first son, MINAMOTO no Yoshitomo, who had been appointed Governor of Shimotsuke Province, took over as the head of the family, other Minamoto clan leaders increasingly switched their support to the more capable and competent Yoshitomo.
sen.cmt: 下野守→Governor of Shimotsuke Provinceとし、Genji→Minamoto clanとしました。

sen.j: それが親子の仲を冷めたものにしてしまったといわれ、為義は義賢を後継として遇した。
sen.e: This is considered to have adversely affected the relationship between the father and the son, causing Tameyoshi to treat Yoshitaka as his heir.
This is considered to have adversely affected the relationship between father and son, causing Tameyoshi to treat Yoshitaka as his heir.

sen.j: それらの結果が保元の乱であり、潔い最後を遂げた事はかろうじて為義の名誉を救ったが、上記のような遠謀は無駄になってしまった。
sen.e: All of these culminated in the outbreak of the Hogen-no-ran war and he died a manly death in it, which barely saved his name and his honor but made his overarching plan mentioned above fruitless.
All of these events culminated in the outbreak of the Hogen Rebellion, where his gallant death helped to partly salvage his reputation but made his long-term plan mentioned above pointless.
sen.cmt: Added "events""-no-ran war"→" Rebellion""and he died a manly death in it, which barely saved his name and his honor"→"where his gallant death helped to partly salvage his reputation""overarching"→"long-term""fruitless→"pointless"
sen.e: All of these events culminated in the outbreak of the Hogen War, where his gallant death helped to partly salvage his reputation but made his long-term plan mentioned above pointless.
sen.cmt: Hogen Warとしました。

sen.j: これらの事績からも明らかなように政戦両略の才に乏しく、偉大な祖父義家、勇猛だった実父義親、政略に長けた養父義忠などの父祖に比較すると、源氏の棟梁というには頼りない人物であった。
sen.e: As his achievements explicitly suggest, he was not talented as a politician, skilled as a strategist, or dependable as the head of Genji when compared to his immediate ancestors: Yoshiie, his great grandfather, Yoshichika, his brave father, and Yoshitada, his adopting father who was a strategist.

As his achievements show, he was not talented as a politician, skilled as a strategist, or dependable as the head of the Genji when compared to his immediate ancestors, Yoshiie, his great grandfather, Yoshichika, his brave father, and the skilled politician, Yoshitada, his adoptive father.
sen.cmt: "explicitly suggest"→"show"Added "the"colon→comma"who was a strategist"→"the skilled politician""adopting"→"adoptive"
sen.e: As his achievements show, he was not talented as a politician, skilled as a strategist, or dependable as the head of the Minamoto clan when compared to his immediate ancestors, Yoshiie, his great grandfather, Yoshichika, his brave father, and the skilled politician, Yoshitada, his adoptive father.
sen.cmt: Genji→Minamoto clanとし、余分なスペースを削除

sen.j: 時代の状況も悪かったが、彼の能力不足も源氏の凋落の要因であったことは否めない。
sen.e: Certainly, the time was against him, but we have to admit that a lack of his ability contributed to Genji's downfall.
It is true that he was a victim of his times but it is also true that his lack of ability contributed to the Genji's downfall.
